learning_outcomes.description: Differentiate and apply program constructs such as variables, selection, iteration and sub-routines
Recognise and apply basic object-oriented design methodologies, along with associated concepts such as classes, instances and methods
Read and analyse programs written by others
Interpret an engineering problem and design an algorithmic solution to the problem
Read and analyse an algorithmic design and be able to translate the design into a working program
Apply techniques for program testing and debugging
Apply sound programming techniques to the solution of real world engineering problems

assessments.task_description: In writing this assignment (and other assessment items) students must not look at anyone else's code or show anyone else their own code. They must also refrain from copying code from the internet or other sources. They must also refrain from using generative AI tools. See assignment sheet for details. Students will need to attend a compulsory interview in the week after the due date, and will be required to sign up for an interview time slot.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignment submitted on-line via Gradescope. Students should submit their code regularly to Gradescope as they progress in the assignment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assignment submissions received after the due time (or any approved extended deadline) will be subject to a 100% late penalty. A one-hour grace period applies to the due time after which time (4:00:00pm) the 100% late penalty will be imposed. This grace period is designed to deal with issues that might arise during submission (e.g. delays with Blackboard or Gradescope) and should not be considered a shift of the due time.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Various due dates throughout semester. See Blackboard for details.
assessments.task_description: See course Blackboard site for details. Students submit their answers to questions on-line. These are normally due by 4pm on a Friday. Students are not allowed to use generative AI tools to answer these questions. The best 8 out of 10 sets of exercises will be used to determine the final mark for this assessment task.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Assignment submissions received after the due time (or any approved extended deadline) will be subject to a 100% late penalty. A one-hour grace period applies to the due time after which time (4:00:00pm) the 100% late penalty will be imposed. This grace period is designed to deal with issues that might arise during submission (e.g. delays with Blackboard or Gradescope) and should not be considered a shift of the due time.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
End of semester exam. The exam will test understanding of the concepts covered over the entire course. 

The exam will be an invigilated multiple choice exam. The exam will be conducted on-campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
